results.title: A Better breed
results.brief_description: An account of the mechanism by which inherited characteristics are handed on from generation to generation, and an introduction to Mendel’s Laws of heredity. Gives examples of the inheritance of one or more characteristics; complete and incomplete dominance; and the recombinations of characteristics resulting in new types; refers to the practical aspects of this in connection with animal husbandry. No other credits available.

results.title: A Bell for Ursli
results.brief_description: This live action film takes place in the Canton of Grisons in Switzerland and illustrates an old custom; when spring comes the village boys chase away the winter with bells, rattles and cracking whips. Ursli, unhappy with his tiny bell, remembers a big bell in his father’s chalet high above the timber-line and sets off to get it.

results.title: A Beethoven sonata
results.brief_description: One of Beethoven’s earliest works is finely played and recorded in this film. Dennis Brain (horn) and Dennis Matthews (piano) give a performance of the Sonata in F for horn and piano, Opus 17. Contrasts the horn as it was in Beethoven’s time with the improved and more complicated instrument of to-day. No other credits available.

results.title: A Beautiful mind [DVD]
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Imagine Entertainment (US), Brian Grazer and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: Ron Howard won accolades (including several Academy Awards) for “A Beautiful mind” which navigates the story of real life Nobel Prize winning mathematician, John Nash. A prodigious if arrogant mastermind, the socially gauche Nash starts at Princeton in 1947 and, after discovering his revolutionary game theory, is soon working as a lecturer at MIT. After being commandeered by the CIA as a code-breaker, Nash works in covert operations of a mysterious nature. After marrying, and worrying that his clandestine assignments are too dangerous to continue with, Nash is hospitalised and diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia. The film details Nash’s life over the next fifty years as he struggles with his mental illness and the weight of his intellect. The screenplay (adapted from the biography by Sylvia Nasar) takes great pains to emphasise that it is the support and love of his wife Alicia that aids this tortuous journey. Howard (Apollo 13, Parenthood, Cocoon) tackles an array of topics - psychological sickness, creativity, insanity, paranoia - but still manages to convey hope for his protagonist, partially (and controversially) by omitting any aspects of Nash’s life that does not fit the Hollywood mould of tortured genius. The adherence to predictable devices (soaring score, turgid dialogue, odes to the triumph of the human spirit) and a refusal to accommodate the more salacious (true) aspects of Nash’s life undermine an otherwise effective film.

results.title: A Bear in hot water
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington takes his first bath at the Brown’s and makes a terrible mess with soap and water. Based on a chapter of the Michael Bond story “A Bear called Paddington”.

results.title: A Bay in the balance
results.creator_credit: Barry Paine and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: In 1972, the Victorian Government responded to a conservation campaign and further industrial development in Westernport was halted. A major scientific study was initiated to examine how the relatively undeveloped bay functions and what future plans should be.

results.title: A Bat, a ball and a boy
results.brief_description: Famous Australian cricketers, including Sir Donald Bradman, Richie Benaud, Ray Lindwall, Len Hutton and Neil Harvey illustrate how to improve a boy’s game from batting to bowling to fielding. Includes archival footage of some of Australia’s greatest players.

results.title: A Banker in paradise
